name: atob
description: atob for Node.JS and Linux / Mac / Windows CLI (it's a one-liner)
readme: atob === Uses `Buffer` to emulate the exact functionality of the browser's atob. Note: Unicode may be handled incorrectly (like the browser). It turns base64-encoded ascii data back **to** binary. ```javascript (function () { "use strict"; var atob = require('atob'); var b64 = "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="; var bin = atob(b64); console.log(bin); // "Hello World" }()); ``` ### Need Unicode and Binary Support in the Browser? Check out [unibabel.js](https://github.com/coolaj86/unibabel-js) Changelog ======= * v2.0.0 provide browser version for ios web workers * v1.2.0 provide (empty) browser version * v1.1.3 add MIT license (see [#4](https://github.com/node-browser-compat/atob/issues/4)) * v1.1.2 node only LICENSE ======= Code copyright 2012-2015 AJ ONeal Dual-licensed MIT and Apache-2.0 Docs copyright 2012-2015 AJ ONeal Docs released under [Creative Commons](https://github.com/node-browser-compat/atob/blob/master/LICENSE.DOCS).
